text: The production by Bill Duncalf compressed a long and sometimes rambling story into a concentrated comprehensive survey of a life work. P.J. K. HANS WERNER HENzE's "Elegy for Young Lovers" is the first unambiguously "contemporary" work to be admitted to the Glyndebourne canon. By no means a masterpiece, it is in many respects a representative modern work and the composer is a highly skilled manipulator of contemporary idioms, with a strong sense of words and situation.
